result.execSummary:
The defendant Oscar Daniel Padilla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Oscar Daniel Padilla is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Oscar Daniel Padilla was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by up to 25% of the defendant's prison wages and by the end of supervision. If not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oscar Daniel Padilla

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per the Order signed today, 10/6/2017 which states "Judgment of convictin shall  be amended to reflect that case 15CF001742 is consecutive to case 11CF005721.
Amending Judgmnt of Conviction, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, calendar successor, for review. spc
Letter from DOC requesting a review of the defendant's judgment of conviction.
Original PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (26 pages) commencing 10/21/2015 received and filed.  CH

Off-the-record discussion held, and then put on the record. Court will allow for restitution claim to be filed within 6 months of sentencing. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS, with credit for ZERO days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
The Court ordered the defendant's operating privileges suspended for 6 MONTHS.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by up to 25% of the defendant's prison wages, and by the end of supervision. If not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Sentence to commence forthwith.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Oscar Daniel Padilla in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Oscar Daniel Padilla in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a jury trial. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
AS TO COUNT 2:
On motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Oscar Daniel Padilla not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court holds final pretrial with counsel in chambers off the record. Matter remains in trial posture, matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 10/21/15 at 9:30am in Br. 35.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Oscar Daniel Padilla not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
   Case adjourned for final pretrial on 10/1/15 and for jury trial on 10/21/15.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.    All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Oscar Daniel Padilla not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-10-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Oscar Daniel Padilla in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Oscar Daniel Padilla in custody.  Ronald Dague for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Oscar Daniel Padilla in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Oscar Daniel Padilla in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
